title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Wednesday 15th November 2017 - BBC News
summary: court told of 'revolting assault by navy officer ' .
kate bushell murder : 'justice long overdue ' - brother .
possession order granted against homeless camp .
falmouth university told to change advertising claims .
south west water : shareholders 'paid more than infrastructure ' .
police hunt driver 'watching porn in van on a38 ' .
eviction fears for riverbank homeless group .
shopping trolley thrown on rail lines .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on thursday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: children in need : how the money is spent
text: children in need : how the money is spent
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: weather : cloudy and rain overnight , dry on thursday
text: remaining largely cloudy and with hill fog is likely in places overnight .
it is going to be dry for many , but some patchy rain will develop later in the night .
minimum temperature : 8 deg c ( 46f ) .
cloud will break on thursday morning , allowing a good deal of dry and fine weather during the first half of the day before it turns cloudy later with some rain .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: crowbar-armed burglar steals £ 800 in raid
text: police are hunting a burglar who made off with £ 800 in cash after threatening a householder with a crowbar in paignton .
officers investigating the aggravated burglary said the offender entered a property on adelphi road between 08:30 and 08:45 on tuesday and `` demanded cash and gold from the occupant '' .
as well as the cash he also made off with clothing and a purse , police said .
the suspect was described as a white man , about 6ft tall , of pale complexion , and of slim build .
he was wearing a black jacket , shiny black trousers , a black balaclava and black gloves .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how a cornwall man talked a woman down from tamar bridge
text: a cornwall biker has been sharing the story of how he talked a vulnerable woman down from tamar bridge .
daniel knill , 42 , was on his way home when he saw the woman standing at the side of the road , looking upset .
he pulled over , took her hand and after speaking to her , managed to lead her to police and to safety .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: sailor 'left shaking after assault by navy officer '
text: a royal navy sailor was left `` shaking and very upset '' after being assaulted by the second-in-command on his devonport-based ship , a court has heard .
the man said he was groped a number of times by charles howeson ( from plymouth .
the man , who ca n't be named for legal reasons , was said to be stuttering words a bit and shaking '' as he told a more senior sailor about what had happened in 1985 .
he said his private parts were groped a number of times on the upper deck of hms cleopatra .
paul edwards , who was the master at arms , in charge of discipline , told the court this was very serious and reported to the captain .
the next day lt cdr howson was airlifted off the ship .
the complainant thought mr howeson had been dismissed but the court was told he was simply switched to another ship and given a warning .
the 67-year-old denies 12 sexual offences against nine different men dating back to the 1980s and 1990s .
the trial , at bristol crown court , continues .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: nancy astor statue : first female mp who sat in parliament
text: a bid has been launched to build a statue to honour the first female mp to take her seat in the house of commons - plymouth 's nancy astor .
a current city mp says he would like to see a memorial to the conservative to mark the 100th anniversary of her election in 1919 to the plymouth sutton ward .
it is hoped the statue will be near lady astor 's former home on plymouth hoe .
but who was she ?
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: exeter to mark 307 squadron day every year
text: exeter now has a new official annual date in its calendar - 15 november is now known as 307 squadron day .
it 's a chance to remember the polish 307 squadron that protected the city during the 1942 blitz in world war two .

the polish flag was raised above the guildhall as part of today 's commemorations ( and the city 's cathedral will be unveiling a commemorative plaque later in memory of the south west-based polish pilots .
it 's 75 years since the city was presented with a polish flag as a sign of international cooperation .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: eden goes green for macmillan
text: it 's known for being green at heart , but tonight the eden project will be glowing green all over for the opening of the cornwall macmillan christmas fair .
the biomes are being lit in support of cornwall 's cancer patients and in memory of the fair founder and president lady mary holborow , who died this year .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: water supply problems in ivybridge
text: pl21 : we are currently investigating reports of no water in # ivybridge .
for updates : # ivybridge

documents.title: kate bushell : nearly 200 messages from information appeal
text: nearly 200 messages have been recently received by police investigating the 20-year-old murder of a devon school girl , officers say .
fourteen-year-old kate bushell was killed while walking her neighbour 's dog in exwick , near exeter , on 15 november 1997 .
police launched a renewed appeal last week for more information about the case to mark the 20-year anniversary .
some officers have come out of retirement to help .
senior investigating officer paul burgan , of devon and cornwall police , said the recent public response `` has been extremely positive '' .
he said : `` we have received around 180 messages and calls , and this continues to rise .
`` this compares to 19 responses received during a similar appeal on the 10th anniversary in 2007 .
we are following a number of viable lines of enquiry as a result . ''
he added : `` however , we are still looking for that one call from someone who may well be wrestling with their conscience and debating whether to call the police .
`` they may be having that debate due to misplaced loyalty or may think they will be treated criminally if they only come forward at this late stage .
let me be very clear , our priority is to apprehend a child murderer and clearly the overwhelming public interest issue is for us to do that . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dad trying to save family from being deported to guatemala
text: a father of two from devon is desperately fighting to prevent his wife from being deported to one of the most dangerous countries in the world - guatemala - breaking up their young family .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: wollaston speaks out over 'mutineer ' status
text: today the front page of the daily telegraph showed a number of conservative party members branded `` mutineers '' for their refusal to back a `` hard '' brexit .
conservative totnes mp dr sarah wollaston , one of those on the front page , has spoken out on the matter .
dr wollaston has been vocal on her blog about her position as both a remain supporter and has commented on the brexit result in june last year .
on further # mutineer news , i have accepted that britain is leaving the eu but setting a fixed date in law at this stage seems unnecessary , premature & may have unintended consequences .
raising questions about this is my job as an mp

you and your tory colleagues will have a lot to answer for after this is all over - ur denial of democracy is astounding as the people 's representatives - it is highly dangerous to usurp the people 's decision for a democracy

the only deniers of democracy are those insisting it should have stopped on 24th june 2016 with a minority of the electorate expressing an opinion in a non-binding ref the ppl have a right to change minds & be allowed to certainly according to david davis .
u may huff and u may puff but it is clearly a denial of democracy not to deliver the result of a referendum given to the electorate by a huge majority of mp 's - to pretend otherwise is pure humbug
not if the will 's changed it needs retesting now we have more actual facts what right do u have to deny such a rethink ?
it might still lead to leaving but if a maj now want to # stopbrexit what gives you the right to deny that or a # finalsay when the eu27 & eu parl have one ?
rachel is right .
a referendum is a snapshot democracy is a process whereby we are fully entitled to ask for another picture to be taken

sure - this is 2nd referendum on our membership of the eu , first was 1975 , result implemented , we decided result was bad for uk so we had another referendum - after 2016 ref implemented & suitable period u too can campaign for a referendum to join the eu - if its still there ?
'and suitable period ' ?
so you 're making up rules now ? !
not how a free democracy works - i can campaign any time richard
sure u can - its a free country - but u portray ur selves increasingly as anti democratic - brexit will happen - and the way ireland is behaving could be sooner than u think
no it is n't sarah .
your job is to support the gov in getting a good deal for the uk which will benefit your constituents .
the fixed date in law is absolutely necessary to wake up the hopeless eu negotiators .
what 's thr point of mps then ?
not a lot of point while we remain in the dictatorship called the eu .
their job will begin when we are fully out and have control .
then it will be time to stop playing politics and put country 1 st
i think you need to think about who 's telling you this .
and the only people who will have control are the billionaires and certain media owners who are for brexit .
what 's good for a billionaire is very unlikely to be good for you .
what is good for these people usually creates wealth and employment for the country .
ah the trickle down economics myth .
does n't work .
more and more of the money is staying in the hands of the rich and ordinary people have fewer adn fewer rights adn can afford less and less ( house prices beyond the reach of most )
oh dear , and socialism just bankrupts a country so no one can be helped .
i run m y own business .
give people jobs .
but when you have so much money you can control the country that is incredibly dangerous
when you deny democracy do n't expect the electorate to tolerate the political class - prepare for a revolution
article 50 hun
no need for the sexist language 'lad '
# snowflake
dickhead
haha i do get what you mean , but did n't mean it in that way , more the odious patronising way i use it often
that 's why it was sexist .
different if it was someone you knew .
but im not letting the hetero 's own this sexism , i was being camp
which is why context matters

on # mutineer news , yes , i will be voting to take back control for parliament rather than a tiny group of ministers when it comes to effective scrutiny of secondary legislation post brexit on behalf of my constituents
i am a bit thick .
are you opposing # brexit or just putting up with it ?
she is being honest about how she feels but the will of the people is not based on honesty , unfortunately !
respect
petition : leaving the single market should be subject to a parliamentary vote :
thank you for doing your job .
her job is to make sure we have a massive brexit bill ? ?
unless the tory party delivers a clean brexit they will be out of power for decades .
i 'm a tory party member but will never vote tory again if you let us down on this issue
if the tory party deliver a clean brexit they will be out of power for decades bcos of all the chaos and crap that will enshue
wrong
not wrong at all thanks
absolutely wrong thanks
we can always change a date - we are not bound to that
thank you .
( our politics are vastly different , but i 'm grateful for every principled tory who are taking an intelligent stand on this instead of yelling abt how this is what we fought for in wwii . )
they fought for independence from a dictatorship !
exactly what she voted against last year and intelligent ? ? ?
`` mr barnier make your brexit bill as high as you like , i 'll make sure we pay it '' yeah , thats bloody genius right there
thank you
why , do you like having higher brexit bill taxes ?
thank you sarah for looking for the right brexit deal .
keep going and keep fighting for a good orderly , sensible brexit that is good for the people and the economy .
do n't let the bullies get you down .
good and thank you .
hurray for the `` mutineers '' !
good on you for making a stand .
# mutiny
meant of course to use # mutineer
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

text: in flushing , near penryn , kersey road is blocked in both directions due to a two-vehicle collision near st peter 's road .

documents.title: possession order granted against homeless camp
text: a group of homeless people who have been living in a makeshift camp in barnstaple will likely have to leave within the month .
following a court hearing this morning , north devon council has succeeded in gaining a possession order for the seven brethren site on which the group is camped , and which the council own .
a possession order is an order made by a court directing that possession of a property be given to the owner .
the council said it was only taking the action after fireworks were illegally let off at the site .
in a statement , the council confirmed that a possession order `` has been made to take effect in 14 days time .
our rough sleeper outreach team is continuing to work with the individuals living at the camp to resolve their housing issues '' .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: fraud investigation into honiton market finances ends
text: a criminal investigation into possible illegal financial irregularities regarding the honiton market finances has ended .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: firearms amnesty guns for more success during first week
text: the two-week amnesty began on monday .
in devon and cornwall , police stations in plymouth , exeter , barnstaple , bodmin and truro are among those across the region taking part in the national initiative .
more ammunition and firearms handed in today as part of # gunsurrender @ twitterid @ twitterid that 's quite a few items taken out of circulation in a short time .
hoping to receive more as the initiative progresses .

documents.title: overton in 'pole position ' for ashes debut
text: craig overton is in `` pole position '' to make his england debut in next week 's first ashes test against australia , says bowling consultant shane bond .
the barnstaple-born pace bowler , 23 , is vying with jake ball for a place in the england side , but ball has missed the final warm-up match with an ankle injury .
`` craig is ahead because we have a guy recuperating from injury , '' bond told bbc sport .
`` jake is a little bit behind and craig has come out and performed well . ''
overton took 2-32 on the first day of england 's final warm-up match against a cricket australia xi in townsville on wednesday .
that followed four wickets against the same opposition in adelaide last week .
`` i was pleased for craig , that was a really good performance , '' added former new zealand international bond .
`` he bowled 18 strong overs , used the short ball and created chances .
he 's building well and he 'll certainly be ready for the test match . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: navy exercise uses rnas culdrose aircraft carrier mock-up
text: exercise kernow flag is making use of the layout of an aircraft carrier which has been built at the cornish base near helston .
it allows personnel to train for working on the royal navy 's latest aircraft carrier , hms queen elizabeth .
the navy said the latest exercise was `` based on a fictitious war in 'kernovia ' - involving camberland ( the baddies ) , redruvia , praa-sandovia and helstopia '' , and would last for 10 days .
can you guess what places in cornwall those names are based on ?
exercise kernow flag update culdrose-based aircraft are now operating from the ( fictitious ) aircraft carrier hms seahawk .
they 're getting ready to protect the carrier task group .
take care of hms seahawk , ssn may be operating in vicinity of tesco 's car park at helston and the flambards liberation front has acquired ground to air missiles .
good work on the home front - we will feed the intelligence back to command
dipping sonar deployed to helston boating lake ?
i spotted a sleek black object sliding below the surface yesterday ( probably a cormorant ) but 'could ' easily have been an enemy mini-sub !
thank you for the intelligence sir .
will report to command at this morning 's exercise kernow flag brief !
it could be the enemy on a surveillance mission
so information will only be given on a need to kernow basis ?
with it being 24 hour 7 day exercise will participant get time of in looe
they kept flying past work yesterday , would be better if they had stopped and done a bow
warning orange forces may conduct disinformation campaign on social media in an attempt to disrupt activities and attempt to generate a false impression of the helston liberation front
russia has tens of thousands of anti ship missiles , no carrier task group stands a chance , unless , its submerged
i like hms seahawk !
i 'm pinching this name !
amazing !
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: keith barron : family 'had a laugh ' at radio cornwall
text: uk actor keith barron , who starred in duty free , has died aged 83 after a short illness .

barron - who was from west riding of yorkshire , but lived in cornwall in recent years - is perhaps best-remembered for his role in the yorkshire television sitcom , duty free , where he played david pearce .
he rose to fame in the 1960s as detective sergeant swift in the odd man .
he has also appeared in coronation street , the professionals , doctor who , benidorm and randall and hopkirk ( deceased ) .
hello today we remember # keithbarron his last interview with me back in july # lovelyman also a workshop on # cornishcarols and @ twitterid @ twitterid 3pm
thank you so much to radio cornwall and the brilliant debbie .
we had such a laugh when we came in to see you in july !
keith loved it ! !
thanks to you and all at the station for your kind words today love mary james & maxine barron
hi maxine , mary and james - sending lots of love to you all so sorry to hear the news , he was just lovely , so kind and funny x
thank you so much hope to talk to you soon xxx
a great guy .
hello today we remember # keithbarron his last interview with me back in july # lovelyman also a workshop on # cornishcarols and @ twitterid @ twitterid 3pm
thank you so much to radio cornwall and the brilliant debbie .
we had such a laugh when we came in to see you in july !
keith loved it ! !
thanks to you and all at the station for your kind words today love mary james & maxine barron
hi maxine , mary and james - sending lots of love to you all so sorry to hear the news , he was just lovely , so kind and funny x
thank you so much hope to talk to you soon xxx
very sad news
author: Debbie McCrory
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: man 'groped by navy officer during man overboard exercise '
text: a man who claims he was groped by a senior royal navy officer whilst at sea has told a court the incident occurred during a man overboard exercise .
the man is one of nine who have accused charles howeson , who lives in plymouth , of serious sexual offences .
the 67-year-old ( denies 12 charges of sexual offences dating back to the 1980s and 1990s .
the man claims to have been indecently assaulted in 1985 , when they were both serving on devonport-based hms cleopatra , which had 210 sailors on board
the man accused mr howeson , second-in-command on the frigate , of groping him while they were manoeuvring a large dummy up stairs .
defence barrister daniel janner qc said to the man : `` it was your imagination '' .
the man replied : `` i wish it was . ''
the man said he did not know until last year that no formal action had been taken following his complaints .
he said : `` i believe the navy wanted to keep this quiet .
here he is , groping a sailor ; the last thing the navy would want would be any scandal in the service .
`` i honestly thought he had been kicked out of the service .
i genuinely thought he had been dealt with . ''
the trial , at bristol crown court , continues .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: appledore finally gets christmas lights after years of fighting
text: after a six-year battle , a devon fishing village can finally put up christmas lights this year .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: kate bushell murder : 'justice long overdue ' - brother
text: twenty years on from the murder of their 14-year-old daughter , the family of kate bushell have urged anyone holding on to vital information to `` find it within themselves '' to come forward to police .
officers have marked the case on the 20th anniversary of her murder , where she was killed while walking her neighbour 's dog in exwick , near exeter , on 15 november 1997 .

kate 's older brother , tim bushell , 35 , said : `` we maintain a joint view with the police that somebody must have that piece of information that will lead to the police apprehending the person who killed kate .
`` we hope that somebody may find it within themselves to let the police have that information .
`` today marks the 20th anniversary of the day i lost my sister in brutal circumstances .
it is long overdue that the killer is brought to justice . ''
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cornwall travel : car fire at a30 chiverton cross
text: there 's slow traffic on the a30 due to a car fire on the chiverton cross roundabout , near truro .
@ twitterid are extinguishing a fire involving 4x4 vehicle on # a30 just off # chivertonroundabout towards bodmin .
@ twitterid are also there assisting with traffic congestion .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: falmouth uni 'disappointed ' at advertising watchdog ruling
text: falmouth university , which has been told to take down marketing claims that could be misleading , says it `` must accept '' a ruling by the advertising watchdog , but added that it was `` disappointed '' at the move .
it was among six uk universities told by the advertising standards authority ( asa ) to take down marketing claims that could be misleading .
falmouth was told to stop describing itself as `` the uk 's number one arts university '' or `` the uk 's number one creative university '' .
the asa said it warned against exaggerated claims made to attract students .

the university said : `` we attributed our 'number one arts university ' status to the sunday times league table and the body responsible for compiling the table wrote in our support during this investigation .
we held this position according to the sunday times - not our own claims .
`` we have not used this phrase in our literature for some time , therefore this ruling does not have any impact on our current or future marketing and so there is no merit in an appeal . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: black people 'nine times more likely ' to be stopped by police
text: figures from the home office have found that in devon and cornwall , black people are almost eight times more likely to be randomly stopped by the police .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: north devon council seeks court order against homeless group
text: representatives of north devon council are currently in court to determine whether they can gain a possession order for the land on which a group of homeless people have set up camp .

council leader des brailey said : `` we have applied to the county court for a possession order , which will enable us to take back the land if those camping on it refuse our offers of accommodation '' .
the council has previously stated that eviction will be `` a last resort '' .
north devon council said it was offering support and alternative accommodation and was only considering taking the action after fireworks were let off at the site .
mr brailey said : `` we 've got two outreach workers that work with them , we 're trying to arrange accommodation for them .
`` once we make that offer , then clearly , if they refuse it , then we would need to move them on . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: court told of 'revolting assault by navy officer '
text: a man has told a court of a `` disgusting revolting incident '' when he was indecently assaulted by a senior royal navy officer whilst at sea .
the man is one of nine who have accused charles howeson , who lives in plymouth , of serious sexual offences .
the 67-year-old ( denies 12 charges of sexual offences dating back to the 1980s and 1990s .
the man claims to have been indecently assaulted by mr howeson in 1985 , when both were serving on devonport-based hms cleopatra , which had 210 sailors on board .
he was asked by mr howeson 's defence barrister if the alleged indecent assault really happened .
he said : `` it was n't trivial - it did happen it was a disgusting revolting incident , '' adding that mr howeson `` was too over-familiar - he made me feel uncomfortable '' .
the trial at bristol crown court continues .
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: weather : cloudy but occasionally brighter later
text: although cloudy at times with a few scattered outbreaks of mainly light rain or drizzle , there will be the occasional brighter period and a perhaps a few sunny intervals .
winds will be from the west or south-west and mainly light to moderate .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
tonight , it 'll be mostly cloudy with a little drizzle in places along with some hill fog patches .
however , the occasional break in the cloud is likely to develop leading to the possibility of some isolated fog patches at lower levels by morning .
winds will remain light or moderate from the southwest .
minimum temperature : 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Kevin Thomas
BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: british and irish cup to be scrapped
text: the british and irish cup will be scrapped at the end of the season after the 12 clubs from england 's second tier championship , including the cornish pirates , decided to withdraw at the end of the season .
'a ' sides from the four irish pro 14 sides and 'premiership select ' teams from the four welsh regions face england 's second tier teams in pool stages and subsequent knockout rounds .
scottish sides pulled out of the event in 2014 and championship sides tend to rest their best players in the cup .
an rfu spokesperson told bbc sport that championship sides were 'looking into alternatives ' for cup competition next season .
clubs play at least three homes games in the tournament , with each side in a pool of four playing their opponents home and away .
the event was set up in 2009 as part of changes which saw the championship replace the old national one as english rugby 's second tier .
the cornish pirates won the first event in 2010 , while munster 'a ' beat jersey in last season 's final .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: keith barron : duty free star dies aged 83
text: uk actor keith barron , who starred in duty free , has died aged 83 after a short illness .
barron - who was from west riding of yorkshire , but lived in cornwall in recent years , rose to fame in the 1960s as detective sergeant swift in the odd man .
he has also appeared in coronation street , the professionals , doctor who , benidorm and randall and hopkirk ( deceased ) .
barron is perhaps best-remembered for his role in yorkshire television sitcom , duty free , where he played david pearce .
author: BBC Entertainment and Arts

documents.title: kate bushell : 20th anniversary appeal
text: police have relaunched a murder appeal on the 20th anniversary of a schoolgirl 's murder .
fourteen-year-old kate bushell was killed while walking her neighbour 's dog in exwick , near exeter , on 15 november 1997 .
devon and cornwall police said the public may still `` hold the vital clue to find the killer and bring them to justice '' .

detectives added that they were `` calling on people to come forward with critical information that they may have withheld at the time , either due to misplaced or divided loyalty , intimidation , or duress , or simply not thought relevant over the years '' .
charity crimestoppers has also offered a £ 10,000 reward for any information that leads to the arrest and conviction of anyone in relation to the murder .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live

documents.title: band speaks of disbelief at black-tie dinner fight
text: the lead singer of a band has spoken of his disbelief as violence erupted on the dance floor at a black-tie golf club annual dinner at a plush hotel .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: children in need : see how some of your money is spent
text: young people cornwall supports county youth clubs and `` helps young people tackle all the challenges and opportunities they face , growing up in cornwall '' .
as we build up towards @ twitterid # pudsey # friday check out how your donations are helping young people in # cornwall via projects like @ twitterid
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: nancy astor : mp backs statue despite policy disagreements
text: a plymouth mp who is backing a bid to build a statue to honour the first female mp to take her seat in the house of commons says he supports the move despite disagreeing with many of her policies
plymouth labour mp luke pollard says he would like to see a memorial to conservative nancy astor , who represented the city from 1919 to 1945 .
he is aiming to mark the 100th anniversary of her election to the plymouth sutton ward and it 's hoped the statue will be near her former home on plymouth hoe .
mr pollard said : `` she was n't just plymouth sutton 's mp , she was the member of parliament for women and it 's right that this is celebrated .
`` i am determined to work cross-party , in her memory and her name to garner support to get more women to stand and be elected in parliament . ''
there is no figure for the cost of the statue , but mr pollard said he would be forming a committee of supporters to raise funds for it .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon travel : road accident at totnes school
text: in totnes , on the a385 , there are reports of an accident outside kevics school ( king edward vi 's school ) .
there 's heavy traffic in the area .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: homeless people in barnstaple camp 'should get support '
text: a group of homeless people living in tents by the river in barnstaple who may be evicted should be given the right help , their supporters say .
north devon council , which owns the land the group is camped on , is expected to apply for a court order that will allow it to move them on .
the authority said it was offering support and alternative accommodation , and was only taking the action after fireworks were let off at the site .
supporter katherine armitage said : `` it 's really important to look after the homeless people , and this is the home of these people .
`` unless there is some alternative , they should not be evicted from this camp . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: ampadu gets first wales start
text: exeter-born chelsea youngster ethan ampadu got his first international start for wales as they drew 1-1 with panama in cardiff .
the 17-year-old , who was the youngest-ever exeter city player when he made his debut aged 15 in september 2016 , played the first 67 minutes of the match .
ampadu made his debut as a substitute against france last week , having moved to chelsea in the summer .
the premier league champions have yet to agree a fee with exeter city for the youngster .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: inactivity rates 'rise ' in wider south west
text: employment rates in the wider south west - the area up to and including the cotswolds and down to cornwall - show an increase in `` labour inactivity '' .
the government defines `` inactivity '' as people `` not in employment who have not been seeking work within the last four weeks and/or are unable to start work within the next two weeks '' .

in the south west , unemployment rates have remained stagnant with an increase of only 0.1 % , the joint second lowest region in the country , according to figures released by the office for national statistics .
inactivity however has increased by 1.3 % among 16-64 year olds in what appears to be a direct transfer from previous employment figures .
the rates for 16-64 year olds are :
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: south west water : 'being profitable encourages investment '
text: south west water has rejected criticism that it 's handing more money to corporate investors and shareholders rather than investing in infrastructure .

the independent research group corporate watch has carried out an investigation into the firm 's handling of customers money and found last year the company invested £ 183m on pipes and reservoirs , but paid owner the pennon group £ 213m .
south west water said : `` we report our operational and financial performance regularly and it is publicly available on our website .
`` being profitable encourages investment and keeps our borrowing costs down - they are one of the lowest in the industry .
`` on average , each customer pays about £ 1.35 a day for our services , less than the cost of a cup of coffee . ''
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: devon travel : accident in plymouth
text: in plymouth , there are reports of an accident on fletemoor road around tamerton avenue .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: high tide times for the region
text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast or seaside , here are the next high water times around devon and cornwall .
we 'll have the latest forecast on bbc spotlight at 13:30 .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: weather : mostly cloudy after fog lifts
text: patchy fog first thing , perhaps slow to clear from some valleys .
today will be mostly cloudy with a chance of some patchy drizzle .
some bright or sunny intervals are possible , especially this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 14c ( 57f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: falmouth told to stop 'uk 's top arts university ' claims
text: falmouth university has been told to stop describing itself as `` the uk 's number one arts university '' by the advertising watchdog .
it was among six uk universities told to take down marketing claims that could be misleading .
leicester , east anglia , strathclyde , teesside and the university of west london also had complaints upheld against them .

the advertising standards authority warned against exaggerated claims made to attract students , with chief executive guy parker saying students need `` good evidence '' when making such a big financial commitment .
falmouth was also told to stop describing itself as `` the uk 's number one creative university '' .
author: BBC News Education

documents.title: argyle youngsters seal man city tie
text: plymouth argyle 's youth team will face premier league leaders manchester city in the fa youth cup after a dramatic second-round win over afc wimbledon .

the pilgrims twice came from a goal down to beat afc wimbledon 3-2 with greek striker klaidi lolos - who joined the club last month after leaving crystal palace - getting the winner in the third and final minute of stoppage time .
city had three players in the england squad which won the under 17 world cup earlier this month including phil foden , who was named as the tournament 's most valuable player .
the tie against city , who have reached the last three finals , is due to be played in plymouth on 16 december .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: plymouth mp 's bid for statue in honour of nancy astor
text: a bid has been launched to build a statue to honour the first female mp to take her seat in the house of commons .
plymouth labour mp luke pollard says he would like to see a memorial to conservative nancy astor , who represented the city .
he is aiming to mark the 100th anniversary of her election in 1919 to the plymouth sutton ward .
it is hoped the statue will be near lady astor 's former home on plymouth hoe .
nancy astor held the plymouth sutton seat for 26 years from 1919 to 1945
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: teacher admits hiding drug money from the courts
text: a teacher who grew cannabis to make `` £ 6,000 every 10 weeks '' has admitted hiding his money from the courts so his partner could benefit from it .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: overton takes two wickets for england
text: barnstaple 's craig overton has taken two wickets on the opening day of england 's final ashes warm-up game against cricket australia xi .
the somerset and former north devon all-rounder took the wickets of top scorer and captain matt short and will pucovski as he returned figures of 2-32 .
overton has yet to make his test debut for england , but with steven finn out of the tour and jake ball struggling with an ankle injury overton could start the first test in brisbane next week .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: water firm shareholders 'paid more than infrastructure '
text: money paid out to south west water from customers ' bills goes more towards shareholders and banks than infrastructure , according to an independent research group .
corporate watch said that last year 's accounts showed the water firm invested £ 183m on pipes , reservoirs and treatment works and paid £ 213m to its owner , the pennon group .
south west water said it was committed to being as transparent and clear as possible .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: falmouth university told to change advertising claims
text: the advertising watchdog has told six uk universities , including one in cornwall , to take down marketing claims that could be misleading .
leicester , east anglia , strathclyde , falmouth , teesside and the university of west london have all had complaints upheld against them .
the advertising standards authority is warning against exaggerated claims made to attract students .
chief executive guy parker says students need `` good evidence '' when making such a big financial commitment .
author: Sean Coughlan
BBC News, education correspondent

documents.title: shopping trolley thrown on rail lines at camborne
text: throwing a shopping trolly & a @ twitterid sign onto the train tracks is an extremely reckless & dangerous thing to do and could have proved fatal .
yet someone in # camborne decided to risk the lives of hundreds of passengers .
know something ?
call 0800 405040 quoting log 54-071117

documents.title: homeless group in barnstaple may face eviction
text: a group of homeless people living in tents by the river in barnstaple could be facing eviction .
north devon council , which owns the land the group is camped on , is expected to apply for a court order that will allow it to move them on .
the authority said it was offering support and alternative accommodation , and was only taking the action after fireworks were let off at the site .
supporters of the homeless said the council needs to make sure those affected are given the right help .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for wednesday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Andrew Segal
BBC Local Live
